meanings.definition: Having or giving off a moderate degree of heat
meanings.sent1: The sun felt warm on my face.
meanings.sent2: The blanket kept me warm during the cold night.
meanings.sent3: The cozy fireplace made the room warm and inviting.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as warm as a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The freshly baked cookies filled the kitchen with a warm aroma.

meanings.sent1: She used a hairdryer to warm her hands.
meanings.sent2: The sun will warm the earth after the rain.
meanings.sent3: The cat likes to warm itself by sitting in the sunbeam.
meanings.sent4: His words warmed her heart on a cold winter day.
meanings.sent5: The hot tea will warm you up quickly.

meanings.sent1: The warm smile of the receptionist made me feel welcome.
meanings.sent2: She has a warm personality that attracts others.
meanings.sent3: The warm gesture of offering her seat to the elderly lady was heartwarming.
meanings.sent4: His warm words of encouragement lifted her spirits.
meanings.sent5: The warm hug from a friend can brighten your day.

meanings.sent1: The crowd began to warm up as the concert started.
meanings.sent2: She will warm to the idea once she understands its benefits.
meanings.sent3: The team started to warm up for the big game.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm warmed the room and inspired others.
meanings.sent5: The audience warmed to the speaker's engaging presentation.

meanings.sent1: The soup needs to warm up before serving.
meanings.sent2: The oven will warm to the set temperature soon.
meanings.sent3: The water in the kettle is starting to warm up.
meanings.sent4: The car engine takes a few minutes to warm to operating temperature.
meanings.sent5: The room will warm to a comfortable level once the heater is turned on.
